text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Israeli newspapers on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
JERUSALEM POST
- Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, Palestinian President Yasser Arafat meet at Erez; the meeting was the message.
- National Infrastructure Minister Ariel Sharon, Science Minister Benny Begin slam Prime Minister for meeting Arafat.
- Palestinian Authority donor conference opens; donors unfazed by hidden account.
- Maman shares up 60% amid takeover rumours. Maman, Israel's air-cargo monopoly, has annual sales in excess of $50 million and 460 employees.
- Attorney General Michael Ben-Yair okays breach of deadline of Bank Leumi selloff of Africa-Israel shares.
- Hilton International to sign deal for hotel in Eilat.
- El Al board delays appointment of new general manager.
HAARETZ
- Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Palestinian Authority chief Yasser Arafat meet for the first time.
- Benny Begin: Netanyahu is working against the government's basic guidelines.
- Jaffa Arabs suspected of planning attacks on lands disputed between Islamic trust and state.
- Senior political and security officials recommend not to release Hamas spiritual leader Sheikh Yassin.
YEDIOTH AHRONOTH
- Prime Minister Netanyahu on Arafat meeting: 'One of the most difficult hours of my life.'
- Netanyahu warns: 'I'll change ministers'.
- Mordechai: 'we needed to talk with the Palestinians a long time ago.'
- Settler heads already discussed possible protest steps.
- Palestinians: peace with the other half of Israel began.
MAARIV
- Historic handshake.
- Netanyahu: 'what went through my stomach is less important than what went through my head.'
- Netanyahu: 'I sent a message of security to Arafat'.
- Clinton: Mission accomplished.
GLOBES
- Main recommendations of Committee on financial investments incentives: don't continue on reducing grants; cancel track for state guarantees.
- Yoel Feldschu appointed El-Al chief.
- Tel Aviv municipality and Tnuva plan massive residential project.
